About the band:
  One of the major bands on New York City's straight-edge hardcore scene, Youth of Today (1985-1990) followed most of the genre's thematic conventions  -- disciplined self-reliance, integrity, left-wing politics, and the evils of meat, alcohol and drugs --  but did so with plenty of inspiring musical energy that alternated between lightning aggression and slower, heavier sections designed for moshing.
